screen_desc: The screenshot shows a confirmation that an item has been added to a shopping cart, specifically an "Insten 18W 2-Port Fast Charger". It mentions standard shipping with an estimated delivery date. Additionally, there is an offer for a 2-Year Electronics Protection Plan by Allstate for $3.00, highlighting benefits like full coverage of parts and labor, free 2-way shipping, and 24/7 customer support, with an option to "Protect your purchase" or "Decline coverage". Below this, there's a section titled "Frequently also added".

action_desc: Click on the 'x' button located at the top right corner to close the offer overlay and reveal the underlying screen which may contain the cart icon.

It seems that the action has removed the previously added item from the shopping cart, as indicated by the cart icon now showing a "1", suggesting that there is only one item in the cart. This action has made progress towards the user's request to add "usb-c" to the cart on Target because it has presumably cleared the previous item from the cart and has returned to the search results page where the user can now add the correct "usb-c" item to the shopping cart.
